In this Ordinance, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context, (a) “adult” means a person who has attained the age of eighteen years or puberty: (b) “authorised medical officer” means a medical officer, howsoever designated, authorised by Government; (c) “Hadd” means punishment ordained by the Holy Quran or Sunnah; (d) “Hirz” means an arrangement made for the custo

law: THE OFFENCES AGAINST PROPERTY (ENFORCEMENT OF HUDOOD) ORDINANCE
text:
3. Ordinance to override other laws
The provisions of this Ordinance shall have effect notwithstanding anything contained in any other for the time being in force.

law: THE OFFENCES AGAINST PROPERTY (ENFORCEMENT OF HUDOOD) ORDINANCE
text:
4. Two kinds of theft
Theft may be either theft liable to hadd or theft liable to tazir.

law: THE OFFENCES AGAINST PROPERTY (ENFORCEMENT OF HUDOOD) ORDINANCE
text:
6. Nisab
The nisab for theft liable to hadd is four decimal four five seven (4.457) grams of gold, or other property of equivalent value, at the time of theft.

law: THE OFFENCES AGAINST PROPERTY (ENFORCEMENT OF HUDOOD) ORDINANCE
text:
7. Proof of theft liable to hadd
The proof of theft liable to hadd shall be in one of the following forms namely: (a) the accused pleads guilty of the commission of theft liable to hadd; and (b) at least two Muslim adult male witnesses, other than the victim of the theft, about whom the Court is satisfied, having regard to the requirements of tazkiyah-al-shuhood, that they are truthful persons and

law: THE OFFENCES AGAINST PROPERTY (ENFORCEMENT OF HUDOOD) ORDINANCE
text:
9. Punishment of theft liable to hadd
(1) Whoever commits theft liable to hadd for the first time shall be punished with amputation of his right hand from the joint of the wrist. (2) Whoever commits theft liable to hadd for the second time shall be punished with amputation of his left foot up to the ankle. (3) Whoever commits theft liable to hadd for the third time, or any time subsequent thereto,

law: THE OFFENCES AGAINST PROPERTY (ENFORCEMENT OF HUDOOD) ORDINANCE
text:
10. Cases in which Hadd shall not be imposed
Hadd shall not be imposed in the following cases, namely: (a) when the offender and victim of the theft are related to each other as spouses, ascendants, descendants, brothers or sisters; (b) when a guest has committed theft from the house of his host; (c) when a servant or employee has committed theft from the hirz of his master or employer to which he

law: THE OFFENCES AGAINST PROPERTY (ENFORCEMENT OF HUDOOD) ORDINANCE
text:
11. Case in which Hadd shall not be enforced
(1) Hadd shall not be enforced in the following cases, namely: (a) when theft is proved only by the confession of the convict, but he retracts his confession before the execution of hadd; (b) when theft is proved by testimony, but before the execution of hadd, any witness resiles from his testimony.

law: THE OFFENCE OF ZINA (ENFORCEMENT OF HUDOOD) ORDINANCE
text:
1. Short title, extent and commencement
(1) This Ordinance may be called the Offence of Zina (Enforcement of Hudood) Ordinance, 1979. (2) It extends to the whole of Pakistan. (3) It shall come into force on the twelfth day of Rabi-ul-Awwal, 1399 Hijri, that is, the tenth day of February, 1979.

law: THE OFFENCE OF ZINA (ENFORCEMENT OF HUDOOD) ORDINANCE
text:
2. Definitions
In this Ordinance, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context: (a) “adult” means a person who has attained, being a male, the age of eighteen years or, being a female, the age of sixteen years, or has attained puberty; (b) “hadd” means punishment ordained by the Holy Quran or Sunnah; (d) “Muhsan” means (i) a Muslim adult man is not insane and has had sexual inter-c

law: THE OFFENCE OF ZINA (ENFORCEMENT OF HUDOOD) ORDINANCE
text:
4. Zina
A man and a woman are said to commit ‘zina’ if they willfully have sexual inter-course without being married to each other.

law: THE OFFENCE OF ZINA (ENFORCEMENT OF HUDOOD) ORDINANCE
text:
5. Zina liable to hadd
(1) Zina is zina liable to hadd if (a) it is committed by a man who is an adult and is not insane with a woman to whom he is not, and does not suspect himself to be, married; or (b) it is committed by a woman who is an adult and is not insane with a man to whom she is not, and does not suspect herself to be, married. (2) Whoever is guilty of zina liable to hadd shall, subjec

law: THE OFFENCE OF ZINA (ENFORCEMENT OF HUDOOD) ORDINANCE
text:
5A. No case to be converted, lodged or registered under certain provisions
No complaint of zina under section 5 read with section 203A of the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1898 and no case where an allegation of rape is made shall at any stage be converted into a complaint of fornication under section 468B of the Pakistan Penal Code (Act XLV of 1860) and no complaint of fornication shall at any stag

law: THE OFFENCE OF ZINA (ENFORCEMENT OF HUDOOD) ORDINANCE
text:
8. Proof of zina liable to hadd
Proof of Zina liable to hadd shall be in one of the following forms, namely: (a) the accused makes before a Court of competent jurisdiction a confession of the commission of the offence; or, (b) at least four Muslim adult male witnesses about whom the Court is satisfied having regard to the requirements of tazkiyah al-shuhood that they are truthful persons and absta

law: THE OFFENCE OF ZINA (ENFORCEMENT OF HUDOOD) ORDINANCE
text:
9. Cases in which hadd shall not be enforced
(1) In a case in which the offence of ‘zina’ is proved only by the confession of the convict, ‘hadd’, or such part of it as is yet to be enforced shall not be enforced if the convict retracts his confession before the hadd or such part is enforced.

law: THE OFFENCE OF ZINA (ENFORCEMENT OF HUDOOD) ORDINANCE
text:
17. Mode of execution of punishment of stoning to death
The punishment of stoning to death awarded under section 5 shall be executed in the following manner namely: Such of the witnesses who deposed against the convict as may be available shall start stoning him, and while stoning is being carried on, he may be shot dead, whereupon stoning and shooting shall be stopped.

law: THE OFFENCE OF ZINA (ENFORCEMENT OF HUDOOD) ORDINANCE
text:
20. Application of Code of Criminal Procedure, 1898 and amendment
(1) The provisions of the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1898 (Act V of 1898), hereafter in this section referred to as the Code, shall apply, ‘mutatis mutandis’, in respect of cases under this Ordinance.

law: THE OFFENCE OF ZINA (ENFORCEMENT OF HUDOOD) ORDINANCE
text:
21. Presiding Officer of Court to be a Muslim
The Presiding Officer of the Court by which a case is tried, or an appeal is heard, under this Ordinance, shall be a Muslim. Provided that, if the accused is a non-Muslim, the Presiding Officer may be a non-Muslim.

law: THE OFFENCE OF ZINA (ENFORCEMENT OF HUDOOD) ORDINANCE
text:
22. Saving
Nothing in this Ordinance shall be deemed to apply to the cases pending before any Court immediately before the commencement of this Ordinance, or to offence, committed before such commencement.

1. Short title, extent and application
(1) This Act may be called the Official Secrets Act, 1923. (2) It extends to the whole of Pakistan, and applies also to all citizens of Pakistan and persons in the service of Government wherever they may be.

2. Definitions
In this Act, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context, definitions of terms such as 'document', 'prohibited place', and others are provided.

3. Offence
A person commits an offence under this Act if they engage in activities that compromise official secrets.

3A. Restriction against photographs, sketches, etc., of prohibited and notified areas
Prohibits the taking of photographs or sketches in certain areas.

4. Communications with enemy or foreign agents to be evidence of commission of certain offence
Establishes that communication with enemies or foreign agents is evidence of committing an offence.

5. Wrongful communication, etc., of information
Defines wrongful communication of information as an offence.

6. Unauthorized use of uniforms; falsification of reports, forgery, personation and false documents
Criminalizes unauthorized use of uniforms and related activities.

6A. Unauthorized disclosure of identities, etc.
Prohibits unauthorized disclosure of identities related to official secrets.

7. Interfering with officers of the police or members of the armed Forces of Pakistan
Criminalizes interference with law enforcement or military personnel.

8. Duty of giving information as to commission of offences
Mandates individuals to report knowledge of offences.

9. Attempts, incitements, etc.
Criminalizes attempts or incitements to commit offences under this Act.

10. Penalty for harbouring spies
Establishes penalties for those who harbor spies.

11. Search warrants
Details the authority to issue search warrants in relation to offences.

12. Power to arrest
Grants powers of arrest to designated authorities.

12A. Investigation etc.
Outlines procedures for investigation of offences.

13. Restriction on trial of offences
Imposes restrictions on the trial of certain offences.

14. Exclusion of public from proceedings
Allows for exclusion of the public from certain legal proceedings.

15. Offences by companies, etc.
Holds companies accountable for offences under this Act.

16. Power to make rules
Empowers the appropriate government to make rules for the implementation of this Act.

1. Short title, extent and commencement
(1) This Act may be called the Official Trustees Act, 1913. (2) It extends to the whole of Pakistan. (3) It shall come into force on such date as the Federal Government, by notification in the official Gazette, may direct.

2. Interpretation Clause
In this Act, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context, 'Government' or 'the Government' means in relation to any Province, the Provincial Government.

3. Extent of jurisdiction of High Courts
For the purposes of this Act the High Court shall have jurisdiction throughout the Province.

4. Official Trustees
(1) The Provincial Government for each Province shall appoint an Official Trustee. (2) No person shall be appointed to the office of Official Trustee who is not an advocate practising in a High Court or a person already in the service of the State.

5. Appointment and powers of Deputy Official Trustees
The Government may appoint a Deputy or Deputies to assist the Official Trustee; and any Deputy so appointed shall, subject to the control of the Government and the general or special orders of the Official Trustee, be competent to discharge any of the duties and exercise any of the powers of the Official Trustee.

6. Official Trustee to be corporation sole to have perpetual succession and official seal, and to sue and be sued in his corporate name
The Official Trustee shall be a corporation sole by the name of the Official Trustee of the Province for which he is appointed and, as such Official Trustee, shall have perpetual succession and an official seal, and may sue and be sued in his corporate name.

7. General powers and duties of official Trustee
(1) Subject to, and in accordance with, the provisions of this Act and the rules made thereunder, the Official Trustee may, if he thinks fit, act as an ordinary trustee. (2) The Official Trustee shall have the same powers, duties and liabilities and be entitled to the same rights and privileges and be subject to the same control and orders of the Co

8. Official Trustee may with consent be appointed trustee of settlement by grantor
(1) Any person intending to create a trust may by the instrument creating the trust and with the consent of the Official Trustee, appoint him to be the trustee of the property subject to such trust.

9. Appointment of Official Trustee as trustee by will
When the Official Trustee has been appointed trustee under any will, the executor of the will shall notify the contents of such will to such Official Trustee.

10. Power of High Court to appoint Official Trustee to be trustee of property
(1) If any property is subject to a trust and there is no trustee within the local limits of the High Court willing or capable to act in the trust, the High Court may on application make an order for the appointment of the Official Trustee.

11. Power of private trustees to appoint official Trustee to be trustee of property
(1) If any property is subject to a trust and all the trustees are desirous that the Official Trustee shall be appointed, it shall be lawful for such trustees to appoint the Official Trustee.

12. Executor or administrator may pay to Official Trustee legacy share etc. of infant or lunatic
(1) If any infant or lunatic is entitled to any gift, legacy or share of the assets of a deceased person, it shall be lawful for the executor or administrator to pay such legacy to the Official Trustee.

17. Fees
Details regarding fees to be prescribed.

18. Disposal of fees
Details regarding the disposal of fees.

19. Auditors to be appointed to examine official Trustee’s accounts etc., and to report to Government
Auditors shall be appointed to examine the accounts of the Official Trustee.

20. Auditor’s power to summon witnesses and to call for documents
Auditors shall have the power to summon witnesses and call for documents.

21. Costs of audit, etc., how paid
Details regarding the payment of audit costs.

22. Right of beneficiary to inspection and copies of accounts
Beneficiaries shall have the right to inspect and obtain copies of accounts.

23. Transfer to Government of accumulations in the hands of Official Trustee
Details regarding the transfer of accumulations to the Government.

24. Mode of proceeding by claimant to recover money so transferred
Details regarding the procedure for claimants to recover transferred money.

25. Power of High Court to make orders in respect of property vested in Official Trustee
The High Court may make orders regarding property vested in the Official Trustee.

26. Who may apply for order under Act
Details regarding who may apply for orders under this Act.

27. Order of Court to have effect of a decree
Orders of the Court shall have the effect of a decree.

28. General powers of administration
Details regarding the general powers of administration.

29. Transfer of trust property by Official Trustee to original trustee or any other trustee
Details regarding the transfer of trust property.

30. Rules
Details regarding the rules to be made under this Act.

31. [Repealed]
This section has been repealed.

32. Saving of Provisions of Registration Act, 1908
Provisions of the Registration Act, 1908 shall be saved.

32A. [Omitted]
This section has been omitted.

33. [Repealed]
This section has been repealed.

law: THE OIL AND GAS DEVELOPMENT CORPORATION (RE- ORGANIZATION) ORDINANCE
text:
1. Short title, extent and commencement
(1) This Ordinance may be called the Oil and Gas Development Corporation (Re-organization) Ordinance, 2001. (2) It extends to whole of Pakistan. (3) It shall come into force at once and shall be deemed to have taken effect on 23rd October, 1997.

law: THE OIL AND GAS DEVELOPMENT CORPORATION (RE- ORGANIZATION) ORDINANCE
text:
2. Definitions
(1) In this Ordinance, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context: (a) “Company” means the Oil and Gas Development Company Limited incorporated under the Companies Ordinance, 1984(XLVII of 1984). (b) “Corporation” means the Oil and Gas Development Corporation established under the Oil and Gas Development Corporation Ordinance, 1961(XXX of 1961); (c) “effective date

law: THE OIL AND GAS DEVELOPMENT CORPORATION (RE- ORGANIZATION) ORDINANCE
text:
3. Conversion of Corporation into a Company
(1) The Corporation shall be deemed to have been converted into a company limited by shares with effect from the date of incorporation of the Company with the Securities, and Exchange Commission of Pakistan, under the Companies Ordinance, 1984(XLVII of 1984). (2) In consideration of the vesting in the Company of the property, rights and liabilities of th

law: THE OIL AND GAS DEVELOPMENT CORPORATION (RE- ORGANIZATION) ORDINANCE
text:
4. Certain special provisions with respect to Company
(1) For the removal of doubts, it is hereby clarified that, as from the date of its incorporation as a Company, the Company shall- (a) be deemed to own and hold all the assets, properties, lands, installations, plants, machinery, equipment, concessions, licences, grants and other rights of whatsoever nature owned and held by the Corporation as

law: THE OIL AND GAS DEVELOPMENT CORPORATION (RE- ORGANIZATION) ORDINANCE
text:
5. Transfer of employees from the Corporation to the Company
(1) All officers, workmen or other employees of the Corporation (hereinafter referred to as the employees) shall, as on the date of incorporation of the Company, be deemed to be employees of the Company on the same remuneration and other conditions of service, rights and privileges including, but not limited to, provisions as to the pens

law: THE OIL AND GAS DEVELOPMENT CORPORATION (RE- ORGANIZATION) ORDINANCE
text:
6. Removal of difficulties
If any difficulty arises in giving effect to any provision of this Ordinance, the Federal Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, make such provisions as may appear to it to be necessary for the purpose of removing the difficulty.

law: THE OIL AND GAS DEVELOPMENT CORPORATION (RE- ORGANIZATION) ORDINANCE
text:
7. Repeal
(1) The Oil and Gas Development Corporation Ordinance, 1961(XXXVII of 1961) is hereby repealed.

1. Short title and extent
This Act may be called the Oilseeds Cesses Act, 1946. It extends to the whole of Pakistan.

2. Definitions
In this Act, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context, 'Collector' means the officer appointed by the Federal Government to perform in any specified area the duties of a Collector under the provisions of this Act and the rules made thereunder, and includes any officer subordinate to that officer whom he may by order in writing authorise to perform his duties unde

3. Imposition of oilseeds cess
There shall be levied and collected on and after the date of the commencement of this Act as cesses for the purposes of this Act, on all oils extracted from oilseeds crushed in any mill in Pakistan, whether the oilseeds are produced in or imported from outside Pakistan, a duty of excise at the rate of one anna per maund, and on all oilseeds exported out of Pakistan,

10. Delivery of monthly returns
The owner of every mill shall furnish to the Collector, on or before the 7th day of each month, a return stating the total amount of oils extracted in the mill during the preceding month, together with such further information in regard thereto as may be prescribed.

11. Collection of duty of excise
On receiving any return made under section 10, the Collector shall assess the amount of the duty of excise payable under section 3 in respect of the period to which the return relates.

12. Finality of assessment and recovery of unpaid duty of excise
Any owner of a mill who is aggrieved by an assessment made under section 11 may, within three months of service of the notice referred to in sub-section (1) of that section, apply to the District Judge for the cancellation or modification of the assessment.

13. Power to inspect mills and take copies of records and accounts
The Collector or any officer empowered by general or special order of the Federal Government in this behalf shall have free access at all reasonable times during working hours to any mill or to any part of any mill.

14. Information acquired to be confidential
All such copies and extracts and all information acquired by a Collector or any other officer from an inspection of any mill or warehouse or from any return submitted under this Act shall be treated as confidential.

17. Power of the Federal Government to make rules
The Federal Government may, after previous publication, make rules for the purpose of carrying into effect the provisions of this Act.

17A. Penalty for contravention of rules
Rules made under section 17 may provide that a breach of any of them shall be punishable with fine not exceeding one thousand rupees.

19. Publication of rules and regulations
All rules made under section 17 shall be published in the official Gazette.

law: THE ORGANIZATION OF THE ISLAMIC CONFERENCE (IMMUNITIES AND PRIVILEGES) ACT
text:
1. Article 1
The Organization of the Islamic Conference shall possess juridical personality. It shall have the capacity: (a) To acquire and dispose of immovable and movable property. (b) To contract. (c) To institute legal proceedings.

law: THE ORGANIZATION OF THE ISLAMIC CONFERENCE (IMMUNITIES AND PRIVILEGES) ACT
text:
2. Article 2
The Organization of the Islamic Conference, its property and assets, wherever located shall enjoy immunity from every form of legal process unless the Secretary General decides to waive it expressly.

law: THE ORGANIZATION OF THE ISLAMIC CONFERENCE (IMMUNITIES AND PRIVILEGES) ACT
text:
3. Article 3
The premises occupied by the Organization of the Islamic Conference shall be inviolable. Its property and assets wherever located shall be immune from search, requisition, confiscation, expropriation and any other form of interference, by executive action.

law: THE ORGANIZATION OF THE ISLAMIC CONFERENCE (IMMUNITIES AND PRIVILEGES) ACT
text:
4. Article 4
The archives of the organization of the Islamic Conference and in general, all documents belonging to it, or held by it, shall be inviolable.

law: THE ORGANIZATION OF THE ISLAMIC CONFERENCE (IMMUNITIES AND PRIVILEGES) ACT
text:
5. Article 5
The organization may, (1) Hold funds, gold or currency of any kind and operate accounts in any currency according to laws and regulations in force in Member States. (2) Be free to transfer its funds, gold or currency from one country to another, or within the country itself and to convert it to any currency according to the laws in force.

law: THE ORGANIZATION OF THE ISLAMIC CONFERENCE (IMMUNITIES AND PRIVILEGES) ACT
text:
6. Article 6
In exercising its rights under Article 5 above, the Organization of the Islamic Conference shall pay due regard to any representations made by Member States, in so far as is considered that effect can be given to such representations, without detriment to the interest of the Organization and Member States.

law: THE ORGANIZATION OF THE ISLAMIC CONFERENCE (IMMUNITIES AND PRIVILEGES) ACT
text:
7. Article 7
The Organization of the Islamic Conference, its movable or immovable property and its assets shall be: (a) Exempt from all direct taxes, except for those which are no more than charges for public utility services. (b) Exempt from custom duties, prohibitions and restrictions on imports and exports in respect of articles imported or exported by the Organization, for its official use.

law: THE ORGANIZATION OF THE ISLAMIC CONFERENCE (IMMUNITIES AND PRIVILEGES) ACT
text:
8. Article 8
The Organization of the Islamic Conference shall enjoy, in the territory of each Member States, for its official communications, treatment not less favourable than that accorded by that State to the communications of any other Member State.

law: THE ORGANIZATION OF THE ISLAMIC CONFERENCE (IMMUNITIES AND PRIVILEGES) ACT
text:
9. Article 9
The Organization of the Islamic Conference may use codes and despatch its correspondence by couriers or bags, which shall have the same immunities and privileges as diplomatic couriers and bags.

law: THE ORGANIZATION OF THE ISLAMIC CONFERENCE (IMMUNITIES AND PRIVILEGES) ACT
text:
10. Article 10
Representatives of Member States to the Principal and subsidiary organs and conferences convened by the organization, shall while exercising their functions and during the journey to and from the place of the meeting, enjoy the following immunities and privileges: (a) Immunity from personal arrest or detention and from seizure of their personal baggage.

law: THE ORGANIZATION OF THE ISLAMIC CONFERENCE (IMMUNITIES AND PRIVILEGES) ACT
text:
11. Article 11
Representatives of Member States in the Principal and subsidiary organs of the Organisation of the Islamic Conference and in conferences convened by the Organization, shall enjoy immunity from legal process in respect of words spoken or written.

law: THE ORGANIZATION OF THE ISLAMIC CONFERENCE (IMMUNITIES AND PRIVILEGES) ACT
text:
12. Article 12
Periods spent by the representatives of Member States to the Principal and Subsidiary organs of the Organization of the Islamic Conference and to conferences convened by it, in one of the territories of a Member State shall not be considered as periods of residence for the assessment of a tax.

law: THE ORGANIZATION OF THE ISLAMIC CONFERENCE (IMMUNITIES AND PRIVILEGES) ACT
text:
13. Article 13
Immunities and privileges are accorded to the representatives of Member States, not for their personal benefits, but in order to safeguard the independent exercise of their functions in connection with the Organization.

law: THE ORGANIZATION OF THE ISLAMIC CONFERENCE (IMMUNITIES AND PRIVILEGES) ACT
text:
14. Article 14
The provisions of Articles 10, 11 and 12 are not applicable as between a representative and the authorities of the State of which he is a national.

law: THE ORGANIZATION OF THE ISLAMIC CONFERENCE (IMMUNITIES AND PRIVILEGES) ACT
text:
15. Article 15
The expression 'representative' in this chapter shall be deemed to include all delegates of Members States, their deputies, advisers and technical experts and secretaries of delegations.

law: THE ORGANIZATION OF THE ISLAMIC CONFERENCE (IMMUNITIES AND PRIVILEGES) ACT
text:
16. Article 16
Permanent State representatives shall enjoy, during the period of their representing their State in the organs of the Organization of the Islamic Conference, such immunities and privileges as are enjoyed by diplomatic envoys.

law: THE ORGANIZATION OF THE ISLAMIC CONFERENCE (IMMUNITIES AND PRIVILEGES) ACT
text:
17. Article 17
The Secretary General shall notify Member States of the Organization, as well as their permanent delegates and members of permanent committees.

law: THE ORGANIZATION OF THE ISLAMIC CONFERENCE (IMMUNITIES AND PRIVILEGES) ACT
text:
18. Article 18
The Conference of the Organization of the Islamic Conference shall specify the categories of officials to which the provisions of Article 19 and the provisions of Chapter VII shall be applied.

law: THE ORGANIZATION OF THE ISLAMIC CONFERENCE (IMMUNITIES AND PRIVILEGES) ACT
text:
19. Article 19
Officials of the General Secretariat of the Organization of the Islamic Conference shall, regardless of their nationality, enjoy the following immunities and privileges: (a) Immunity from legal process, in respect of words spoken or written and all acts performed by them in their official capacity.

law: THE ORGANIZATION OF THE ISLAMIC CONFERENCE (IMMUNITIES AND PRIVILEGES) ACT
text:
20. Article 20
Further to the immunities and privileges provided for by the two preceding articles, the Secretary General, Assistant Secretary General and senior officials, together with their spouses and their minor children, shall enjoy immunities and privileges, which are accorded, in accordance with international law, to diplomatic envoys.

law: The Pakistan Aeronautical Complex Board Ordinance
text:
1. Short title, extent and commencement.
(1) This Ordinance may be called the Pakistan Aeronautical Complex Board Ordinance, 2000. (2) It extends to the whole of Pakistan. (3) It shall come into force at once.

law: The Pakistan Aeronautical Complex Board Ordinance
text:
2. Definitions.
In this Ordinance, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context, (a) 'Board' means the Pakistan Aeronautical Complex Board Kamra established under section 3; (b) 'Chairman' means the Chairman of the Board; (c) 'factory' means a Pakistan Aeronautical Complex factory established by the Federal Government and functioning under the control of the Board; and (d) 'member'

law: The Pakistan Aeronautical Complex Board Ordinance
text:
3. Establishment of the Board.
(1) As soon as may be after the commencement of this Ordinance, the Federal Government shall, by notification in the official gazette, establish, for carrying out the purposes of this Ordinance, a Pakistan Aeronautical Complex Board consisting of a Chairman and five members appointed by it. (2) The Chairman shall be appointed by the Federal Government on recommendati

law: The Pakistan Aeronautical Complex Board Ordinance
text:
4. Terms of office of the members.
(1) The Chairman and members shall hold office during the pleasure of the Federal Government for a term of four years and, unless earlier removed, shall be eligible for re-appointment and shall receive such salary and allowances as the Federal Government may determine: Provided that the Member (Private) shall hold office in honorary capacity. (2) Every member, ex

law: The Pakistan Aeronautical Complex Board Ordinance
text:
5. Meetings.
(1) No business of the Board shall be transacted except at a meeting at which a quorum of three Members is present. (2) The Chairman or, in his absence, senior most member shall preside at the meetings of the Board. (3) At the meetings of the Board each member shall have one vote and, in the event of equality of votes, the Chairman or the member presiding shall have a second or castin

law: The Pakistan Aeronautical Complex Board Ordinance
text:
6. Functions of the Board.
(1) The principal function of the Board shall be to manage, organize or, as the case may be, re-organize, within the existing financial resources, any factory and administer the affairs of the factories and to run them on sound commercial lines so as to adequately meet, during war and peace, the needs of the defence of the country. (2) The Board shall, in discharging its

law: The Pakistan Aeronautical Complex Board Ordinance
text:
7. Investment of the Board with certain powers.
Notwithstanding anything contained in any law, regulation, rule, order, notification, agreement or other instrument for the time being applicable to any factory, or any officer or other employee appointed or engaged in, or in connection with, any factory, the Board may, in relation to such factory, officer or employee, exercise the following powers o

law: The Pakistan Aeronautical Complex Board Ordinance
text:
8. Submission of estimates of receipts and expenditures to the Federal Government.
(1) The Board shall, in the month of December every year, submit, in such manner and form as the Federal Government may direct, to the Federal Government, for making necessary provision in its budget, a statement of the discharge of its functions under this Ordinance in respect of the new financial year together wit

law: The Pakistan Aeronautical Complex Board Ordinance
text:
9. Accounts and audit etc.
(1) The Board shall maintain its accounts including those of the factories in such manner and form as may be prescribed by the Federal Government in consultation with the Auditor-General of Pakistan. (2) The accounts of the Board, including those of the factories, shall be audited by the Auditor-General of Pakistan. (3) The Board shall, within six months after the end of

law: The Pakistan Aeronautical Complex Board Ordinance
text:
10. Submission of annual report, returns, etc.
(1) The Board shall, as soon as possible after the end of every financial year but not later than the thirty-first day of December next following, submit to the Federal Government a report on the conduct of the affairs of the Board during the year. (2) The Federal Government may require the Board to furnish it with- (a) any return, statement, estimate

law: The Pakistan Aeronautical Complex Board Ordinance
text:
11. Delegation of Powers.
The Board may, from time; to time, authorize the Chairman, any one or more of its members or any subordinate authority of the Board to perform such functions or exercise such powers on its behalf as may be specified by the Board through a resolution passed at a meeting with proper quorum, and the Chairman, member or subordinate authority so authorized shall conform to suc

law: The Pakistan Aeronautical Complex Board Ordinance
text:
12. Mode of signifying communications from the Board.
Any notice, determination, direction, requisition, appointment, expression of opinion, approval or sanction to be given or signified on the part of the Board for any of the purposes of, or in relation to, any powers or functions with which it has been invested under this Ordinance, shall be sufficient and binding if it is in writing signed by t

law: The Pakistan Aeronautical Complex Board Ordinance
text:
13. Power to issue directions.
The Federal Government may, from time to time, issue directions to the Board to take such measures as it considers necessary for the efficient management of the factories.

law: THE PAKISTAN ANIMAL QUARANTINE (IMPORT AND EXPORT OF ANIMALS AND ANIMAL PRODUCTS) ORDINANCE
text:
1. Short title, extent and commencement.
(1) This Ordinance may be called the Pakistan Animal Quarantine (Import and Export of Animals and Animal Products) Ordinance, 1979. (2) It extends to the whole of Pakistan. (3) It shall come into force at once.

law: THE PAKISTAN ANIMAL QUARANTINE (IMPORT AND EXPORT OF ANIMALS AND ANIMAL PRODUCTS) ORDINANCE
text:
2. Definitions.
In this Ordinance, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context, various definitions are provided for terms such as 'animal', 'animal product', 'carcase', 'diseased', 'fodder', 'health certificate', 'import', 'export', 'litter', 'prescribed', 'points of entry', 'points of exit', 'quarantine', 'Quarantine Officer', and 'rules'.

law: THE PAKISTAN ANIMAL QUARANTINE (IMPORT AND EXPORT OF ANIMALS AND ANIMAL PRODUCTS) ORDINANCE
text:
3. Power to regulate and prohibit import and export of animals and animal products.
(1) The Federal Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, prohibit, restrict or otherwise regulate, subject to such conditions as it may think fit to impose, the import or export of any animal or class of animals or animal products likely to introduce diseases to any other animal, animal product or m

law: THE PAKISTAN ANIMAL QUARANTINE (IMPORT AND EXPORT OF ANIMALS AND ANIMAL PRODUCTS) ORDINANCE
text:
4. Operation of notification under section 3.
A notification under section 3 shall operate as if it had been issued under section 16 of the Customs Act, 1969 (IV of 1969), and the officers of customs shall have the same powers in respect of any animal or animal product in respect of which such a notification has been issued.

law: THE PAKISTAN ANIMAL QUARANTINE (IMPORT AND EXPORT OF ANIMALS AND ANIMAL PRODUCTS) ORDINANCE
text:
5. Control of animals and animal products in quarantine.
All animals and animal products detained in quarantine shall be under the control of the Quarantine Officer and shall be dealt with in the prescribed manner.

law: THE PAKISTAN ANIMAL QUARANTINE (IMPORT AND EXPORT OF ANIMALS AND ANIMAL PRODUCTS) ORDINANCE
text:
6. Powers, duties and functions of Quarantine Officer.
Subject to the provisions of this Ordinance, the Quarantine Officer shall have the power to inspect animals and animal products, detain in and release from quarantine, issue health certificates, and order destruction of diseased animals or animal products.

law: THE PAKISTAN ANIMAL QUARANTINE (IMPORT AND EXPORT OF ANIMALS AND ANIMAL PRODUCTS) ORDINANCE
text:
7. Cognizance of offence.
No Court shall take cognizance of any offence under this Ordinance, except upon complaint in writing made by an officer authorised by the Federal Government in this behalf.

law: THE PAKISTAN ANIMAL QUARANTINE (IMPORT AND EXPORT OF ANIMALS AND ANIMAL PRODUCTS) ORDINANCE
text:
8. Penalties.
(1) Whoever contravenes or attempts to contravene any of the provisions of this Ordinance shall be punishable with imprisonment for a term which may extend to three years, or with fine which may extend to five thousand rupees, or with both.

law: THE PAKISTAN ANIMAL QUARANTINE (IMPORT AND EXPORT OF ANIMALS AND ANIMAL PRODUCTS) ORDINANCE
text:
9. Appointment of officers and members of staff.
The Federal Government may appoint such number of officers and members of staff as it may deem fit for carrying out the purposes of this Ordinance.

law: THE PAKISTAN ANIMAL QUARANTINE (IMPORT AND EXPORT OF ANIMALS AND ANIMAL PRODUCTS) ORDINANCE
text:
10. Revision.
(1) Any person aggrieved by an order passed by the Quarantine Officer under this Ordinance may apply for revision to the Federal Government within thirty days from the date of issue of such order.

law: THE PAKISTAN ANIMAL QUARANTINE (IMPORT AND EXPORT OF ANIMALS AND ANIMAL PRODUCTS) ORDINANCE
text:
11. Indemnity.
No suit, prosecution or other legal proceedings shall lie against the Federal Government or the Quarantine Officer for anything in good faith done or intended to be done under this Ordinance.

law: THE PAKISTAN ANIMAL QUARANTINE (IMPORT AND EXPORT OF ANIMALS AND ANIMAL PRODUCTS) ORDINANCE
text:
12. Exemption.
The Federal Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, exempt any animal or animal product from the operation of all or any of the provisions of this Ordinance.

law: THE PAKISTAN ANIMAL QUARANTINE (IMPORT AND EXPORT OF ANIMALS AND ANIMAL PRODUCTS) ORDINANCE
text:
13. Delegation of powers.
The Federal Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, delegate to a Provincial Government, or to any officer or authority of such Government, any of its powers under this Ordinance.

law: THE PAKISTAN ANIMAL QUARANTINE (IMPORT AND EXPORT OF ANIMALS AND ANIMAL PRODUCTS) ORDINANCE
text:
14. Power to make rules.
(1) The Federal Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, make rules for carrying out the purposes of the Ordinance.

law: THE PAKISTAN ARMED FORCES NURSING SERVICE ACT
text:
1. Short title, application and commencement
(1) This Act may be called the Pakistan Armed Forces Nursing Service Act, 1952. (2) It applies to the members of the Pakistan Armed Forces Nursing Service wherever they may be. (3) It shall come into force at once and shall be deemed to have taken effect on the tenth day of May, 1951.

law: THE PAKISTAN ARMED FORCES NURSING SERVICE ACT
text:
2. Definitions
In this Act, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context, (a) “prescribed” means prescribed by rules made under this Act; (b) “regulations” means regulations made under this Act.

law: THE PAKISTAN ARMED FORCES NURSING SERVICE ACT
text:
3. Constitution of Pakistan Armed Forces Nursing Service
There shall be raised and maintained, in the manner hereinafter provided, as part of the Armed Forces of Pakistan, a force which shall be designated the Pakistan Armed Forces Nursing Service.

law: THE PAKISTAN ARMED FORCES NURSING SERVICE ACT
text:
4. Liability for service of members of the Pakistan Armed Forces Nursing Service
The members of the Pakistan Armed Forces Nursing Service shall be liable for service with the force or persons subject to the Pakistan Army Act, 1952 (XXXIX of 1952), the Pakistan Air Force Act, 1953 (VI of 1953) or the Pakistan Navy Ordinance, 1961 (XXXV of 1961).

law: THE PAKISTAN ARMED FORCES NURSING SERVICE ACT
text:
5. Members to be of commissioned rank
All members of the Pakistan Armed Forces Nursing Service shall be of commissioned rank and shall be appointed as officers of the Pakistan Armed Forces Nursing Service by the Federal Government, by notification in the official Gazette.

law: THE PAKISTAN ARMED FORCES NURSING SERVICE ACT
text:
6. Eligibility for appointment
(1) Any female citizen shall be eligible for appointment as an officer in the Pakistan Armed Forces Nursing Service and, if she satisfies the prescribed conditions, may be appointed thereto in the manner laid down in section 5 of this Act: Provided that a woman who is not a citizen of Pakistan but who otherwise fulfils the conditions laid down by, or under this secti

law: THE PAKISTAN ARMED FORCES NURSING SERVICE ACT
text:
7. Dismissal and removal of officers
The Federal Government, or any authority empowered by the Federal Government in this behalf, may dismiss, remove, release, or cause of retirement of, any officer from the Pakistan Armed Forces Nursing Service.

law: THE PAKISTAN ARMED FORCES NURSING SERVICE ACT
text:
8. Training and duties of officers
Subject to the provisions of this Act, an officer of the Pakistan Armed Forces Nursing Service shall be bound to undergo such training and in such manner and to perform such duties in connection with the forces and persons subject to any of the enactments referred to in section 4 as may be laid down by regulations.

law: THE PAKISTAN ARMED FORCES NURSING SERVICE ACT
text:
9. Application of the Pakistan Army Act, 1952, the Pakistan Air Force Act, 1953, and the Pakistan Navy Ordinance, 1961
(1) The provisions of the Pakistan Army Act, 1952 (XXXIX of 1952), shall, to such extent and subject to such adaptations and modifications as may be prescribed, apply to officers of the Pakistan Armed Forces Nursing Service, who may be serving with forces and persons subject to th

law: THE PAKISTAN ARMED FORCES NURSING SERVICE ACT
text:
10. Power to make rules
(1) The Federal Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, make rules to carry out the purposes of this Act. (2) In particular and without prejudice to the generality of the foregoing power, rules may be made under this section, (a) providing for the medical examination of persons offering themselves for appointment in the Pakistan Armed Forces Nursing Service

law: THE PAKISTAN ARMED FORCES NURSING SERVICE ACT
text:
11. Power to make regulations
Any officer or authority empowered in this behalf by the Federal Government may make regulations not inconsistent with this Act and rules made thereunder, providing for all matters to be laid down by regulations and generally for all details connected with the organization, pay, allowances, duties, discipline, training, clothing, equipment and leave of members of the

law: THE PAKISTAN (ARMY AND AIR FORCE) RESERVES ACT
text:
1. Short title and commencement
This Act may be called the Pakistan (Army and Air Force) Reserves Act, 1950.

law: THE PAKISTAN (ARMY AND AIR FORCE) RESERVES ACT
text:
2. Definitions
In this Act, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context, 'prescribed' means prescribed by rules made under this Act; 'Reserves' means the Reserves of the Pakistan Army or of the Pakistan Air Force; 'reservist' means a member of the Reserves.

law: THE PAKISTAN (ARMY AND AIR FORCE) RESERVES ACT
text:
3. Divisions of Reserve Forces
(1) The Reserves shall consist of the categories specified in the Schedule to this Act. (2) The Federal Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, add to, amend or vary the Schedule to this Act.

law: THE PAKISTAN (ARMY AND AIR FORCE) RESERVES ACT
text:
4. Liability of reservists to military or air force law
An Army reservist shall be subject to the Pakistan Army Act, 1952 (XXXIX of 1952), and the rules and regulations made thereunder and an Air Force reservist shall be subject to the Pakistan Air Force Act, 1953 (VI of 1953), and the rules and regulations made thereunder, in such manner and to such extent as may be prescribed.

law: THE PAKISTAN (ARMY AND AIR FORCE) RESERVES ACT
text:
5. Extent of liability for service
A reservist shall be liable to serve without the limits of Pakistan as well as within those limits.

law: THE PAKISTAN (ARMY AND AIR FORCE) RESERVES ACT
text:
6. Power to make rules
(1) The Federal Government may make rules to carry out the purposes of this Act. (2) In particular and without prejudice to the generality of the foregoing power, such rules may (a) provide for the constitution of, and the appointment or transfer of any person as a reservist to, the reserves; (b) prescribe the service obligations to which reservists shall be liable; (c) pres

law: THE PAKISTAN (ARMY AND AIR FORCE) RESERVES ACT
text:
7. Power to make regulations
In the case of Army reservists, the Chief of the Army Staff, and in the case of Air Force reservists, the Chief of the Air Staff may make regulations not inconsistent with this Act and rules made thereunder, providing generally for all details connected with the training, clothing, equipment and leave of reservists.

law: THE PAKISTAN BANKING AND FINANCE SERVICES COMMISSION ACT
text:
1. Short title and commencement
(1) This Act may be called the Pakistan Banking and Finance Services Commission Act, 1992. (2) It shall come into force at once.

law: THE PAKISTAN BANKING AND FINANCE SERVICES COMMISSION ACT
text:
2. Definitions
In this Act, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context, (a) “Commission” means the Pakistan Banking and Finance Services Commission established under section 3; (b) “financial institution” means an institution referred to in the Schedule; (c) “Member” means a member of the Commission; (d) “recruitment” means initial appointment otherwise than by promotion or trans

law: THE PAKISTAN BANKING AND FINANCE SERVICES COMMISSION ACT
text:
3. Establishment of the Commission
There shall be established for the purposes of this Act a Commission to be called the Pakistan Banking and Finance Services Commission and consisting of a Chairman and not more than four members appointed by the Federal Government.

law: THE PAKISTAN BANKING AND FINANCE SERVICES COMMISSION ACT
text:
4. Salary, Allowances and privileges
The Chairman and the Members shall be entitled to such salary, allowances, and privileges as the Federal Government may determine from time to time.

law: THE PAKISTAN BANKING AND FINANCE SERVICES COMMISSION ACT
text:
5. Term of office
The Chairman and Members shall hold office for such term as may be determined by the Federal Government.

law: THE PAKISTAN BANKING AND FINANCE SERVICES COMMISSION ACT
text:
6. Resignation and filling of vacancies
(1) The Chairman or a member may, by writing under his hand addressed to the Federal Government, resign his office. (2) Any vacancy occurring in the membership of the Commission due to death, resignation or removal shall be filled by the appointment of another person by the Federal Government.

law: THE PAKISTAN BANKING AND FINANCE SERVICES COMMISSION ACT
text:
7. Functions of the Commission
The functions of the Commission shall be- (a) to conduct open competitive examinations for recruitment to Grade III or higher posts in the financial institutions; (b) to conduct interviews and tests for recruitment to posts in grades higher than Grade III, except where such recruitment is excluded from the purview of the Commission by the Federal Government; (c) to c

law: THE PAKISTAN BANKING AND FINANCE SERVICES COMMISSION ACT
text:
8. Recruitment to posts in financial Institutions
(1) Recruitment to all posts in Grade III or higher grades in a financial institution shall be made on the advice of the Commission: Provided that the Commission may, on the direction of the Federal Government, advise any financial institution for recruitment in any post or grade. (2) The Commission may exempt any professional or class of professio

law: THE PAKISTAN BANKING AND FINANCE SERVICES COMMISSION ACT
text:
9. Funds of the Commission
(1) There shall be constituted for the Commission a fund to which shall be credited all sums received under sub-section (2) and out of which shall be defrayed all expenditure incurred by the Commission, including expenditure on the emoluments of the Chairman and members and the officers, employees, experts and consultants of the Commission. (2) Every financial institutio

law: THE PAKISTAN BANKING AND FINANCE SERVICES COMMISSION ACT
text:
10. Appointment of officers, employees, etc.
For the efficient performance of its functions, the Commission may appoint its officers, employees experts, and consultants, on such terms and conditions as may be prescribed.

law: THE PAKISTAN BANKING AND FINANCE SERVICES COMMISSION ACT
text:
11. Report of the Commission
The Commission will submit to the President annually a report on the work done by the Commission.

law: THE PAKISTAN BANKING AND FINANCE SERVICES COMMISSION ACT
text:
12. Power to amend Schedule
The Federal Government may, keeping in view the purposes of this Act, by notification in the official Gazette, amend the Schedule so as to add any entry thereto or omit or modify any entry therein.

law: THE PAKISTAN BANKING AND FINANCE SERVICES COMMISSION ACT
text:
13. Act to override other laws
The provisions of this Act shall have effect notwithstanding anything contained in any other law, or in any instrument, deed or other document relating to a financial institution.

law: THE PAKISTAN BANKING AND FINANCE SERVICES COMMISSION ACT
text:
14. Power to make rules
(1) The Commission may, with the approval of the Federal Government, by notification in the official Gazette, make rules for carrying out the purposes of this Act. (2) In particular and without prejudice to the generality of the foregoing power, such rules may provide for the appointment of officers, employees, experts and consultants and for the payment of travelling allow

law: The Pakistan Banking (Prevention of Default and Evasion of Liabilities) Ordinance
text:
1. Short title, extent and commencement
(1) This Ordinance may be called the Pakistan Banking (Prevention of Default and Evasion of Liabilities) Ordinance, 1947. (2) It extends to the whole of Pakistan. (3) It shall come into force at once.

law: The Pakistan Banking (Prevention of Default and Evasion of Liabilities) Ordinance
text:
2. Definitions
In this Ordinance (a) 'Bank' means the Imperial Bank of India and any banking company as defined in section 277F of the Indian Companies Act, 1913 (VII of 1913) and includes any branch of a bank. (b) 'Manager' includes the term Agent or Sub-Agent and any other officer having charge of any branch or agency of any bank in Pakistan. (c) 'Federal Government' means the Government of Paki

law: The Pakistan Banking (Prevention of Default and Evasion of Liabilities) Ordinance
text:
3. No Bank to Stop payment of cheques or delivery of deposits under instructions from any Government authority outside Pakistan
No Bank operating in Pakistan shall act on the instructions of a Government or authority other than the Government of Pakistan issued to it direct or through its Head Office outside Pakistan, in regard to stopping of payment of cheques, delivery of securities or things he

law: The Pakistan Banking (Prevention of Default and Evasion of Liabilities) Ordinance
text:
4. Procedure for demanding explanation and search
(1) On receiving a complaint that a Bank is wrongfully withholding the payment of a cheque or the delivery of anything held in deposit or safe custody, the Federal Government may by order require the Bank to explain the grounds on which it has withheld or delayed payment of the cheque or delivery of the thing held in deposit or safe custody and to

law: The Pakistan Banking (Prevention of Default and Evasion of Liabilities) Ordinance
text:
5. Order to prohibit removal of assets outside Pakistan
While ordering a Bank to furnish a statement under Section 4, the Federal Government may order the Bank not to remove out of Pakistan any thing held in safe custody on behalf of the person referred to in sub-section (1) of section 4 or any documents related thereto.

law: The Pakistan Banking (Prevention of Default and Evasion of Liabilities) Ordinance
text:
6. Seizure of assets
(1) If the Federal Government after considering such explanation as the Bank concerned may have given, the information secured by any action taken under sub-sections (2) and (3) of Section 4 and such further enquiry as it may deem necessary, is satisfied that the Bank has wrongfully withheld payment of a cheque wholly or partially or the delivery of anything held in deposit or

law: The Pakistan Banking (Prevention of Default and Evasion of Liabilities) Ordinance
text:
7. Service of orders under Section 4, 5 or 6
An order under Sections 4, 5 or 6 may be served on the Manager by delivery at the office of the Bank. If service of the order is refused or any attempt is made to avoid it, the order may be affixed on the premises of the Bank in the presence of two witnesses and the order shall then be deemed to have been duly served.

law: The Pakistan Banking (Prevention of Default and Evasion of Liabilities) Ordinance
text:
8. Penalties
If the Manager of a Bank: (a) fails to comply with an order to furnish a statement under Section 4 or if he furnishes a statement which he knows to be false in any material particular; or (b) refuses to allow, or fails to afford, reasonable facilities to an Officer authorised under Section 4; or (c) having been served with or having knowledge or information of an order under Section 5

law: The Pakistan Banking (Prevention of Default and Evasion of Liabilities) Ordinance
text:
9. Withdrawal or amendment of orders under Sections 5 and 6
On sufficient cause being shown the Federal Government may withdraw or amend all or any of the orders made under Sections 5 and 6 of this Ordinance.

law: The Pakistan Banking (Prevention of Default and Evasion of Liabilities) Ordinance
text:
10. Bar of legal proceedings
No suit, prosecution or other legal proceedings shall lie against any person or against the Federal Government for anything done or in good faith intended to be done under this Ordinance.

law: The Pakistan Banking (Prevention of Default and Evasion of Liabilities) Ordinance
text:
11. Powers to make rules
The Federal Government may make rules for the purpose of giving effect to this Ordinance.

law: THE PAKISTAN BOY SCOUTS ASSOCIATION ORDINANCE
text:
1. Short title, extent and commencement
(1) This Ordinance may be called the Pakistan Boy Scouts Association Ordinance, 1959. (2) It extends to the whole of Pakistan. (3) It shall come into force on such date as the Federal Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, appoint.

law: THE PAKISTAN BOY SCOUTS ASSOCIATION ORDINANCE
text:
2. Incorporation of Association
Notwithstanding anything in the Societies Registration Act, 1860 (XXI of 1860), or in any other law, the Pakistan Boy Scouts Association, for the time being registered thereunder, shall, on the commencement of this Ordinance, cease to be so registered, and shall be deemed to be a body corporate, by the name of the Pakistan Boy Scouts Association (hereafter in this O

law: THE PAKISTAN BOY SCOUTS ASSOCIATION ORDINANCE
text:
3. Constitution, powers and functions of Association
The constitution, powers and functions of the Association shall, notwithstanding anything in the Companies Act, 1913 (VII of 1913), be such as may be prescribed by rules to be made by the Association, with the previous approval in writing of the Federal Government, and until such rules are made, the rules of the Pakistan Boy Scouts Association r

law: THE PAKISTAN BOY SCOUTS ASSOCIATION ORDINANCE
text:
4. Exclusive right to titles, uniforms, badges, etc.
The Association shall have the sole and exclusive right to have and to use all emblems, badges, uniforms and decorations, descriptive or designating marks and titles, now or heretofore used by the Association, and also the title 'Boy Scouts' or (saving the title of any unit of the Armed Forces of Pakistan or any Forces attached to or serving wit

law: THE PAKISTAN BOY SCOUTS ASSOCIATION ORDINANCE
text:
5. Penalty, etc.
(1) Whoever contravenes any provision of section 4 shall be punishable with fine. (2) If such contravention is committed by a company, association or body of individuals, every member thereof who is knowingly a party to the contravention shall be deemed to be guilty of such contravention.

law: THE PAKISTAN BOY SCOUTS ASSOCIATION ORDINANCE
text:
6. [Omitted]
Omitted by the Federal Laws (Revision and Declaration Ordinance, 1981 (Ordinance No. XXVII of 1981), s. 3 and II Sch.

1. Short title, extent and commencement
(1) This Act may be called the Pakistan Broadcasting Corporation Act, 1973. (2) It extends to the whole of Pakistan. (3) It shall come into force at once and shall be deemed to have taken effect on the twentieth day of December, 1972.

2. Definitions
In this Act, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context, (a) “Board” means the Board of Directors of the Corporation; (b) “Chairman” means the Chairman of the Board; (c) “Corporation” means the Pakistan Broadcasting Corporation established under section 3; (d) “Member” means a Member of the Board; (e) “regulation” means a regulation made under this Act; (f) “rule”

3. Establishment of the Corporation
(1) As from the commencement of this Act, there shall be established a Corporation to be called the Pakistan Broadcasting Corporation. (2) The Corporation shall be a body corporate by the name of the Pakistan Broadcasting Corporation, having perpetual succession and a common seal, with power to hold and dispose of property, and shall by the said name sue and be

3A. Application of Act VII of 2023
(1) The provisions of the State-Owned Enterprises (Governance and Operations) Act, 2023 (VII of 2023) shall apply to the Pakistan Broadcasting Corporation which shall be deemed to be a state-owned enterprise for the purposes of the said Act. (2) Where any inconsistency arises in a provision of the said Act and a provision of this Act for the purpose of governance

4. Board
(1) The general direction and the administration of the Corporation shall vest in a Board consisting of members appointed by the Federal Government. (2) The members, other than ex-officio members, shall hold office for a term of three years and shall be eligible for re-appointment but in no case for more than two consecutive terms.

6. Removal of independent members
The Federal Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, remove an independent member in accordance with the provisions of the SOE Act.

7. Meetings of the Board
(1) The Board shall meet at such time and such place as may be prescribed by regulations. (2) Not less than fifty percent of total membership of the Board including not less than four independent and one ex-officio members shall constitute quorum for a meeting of the Board.

8. Director-General
(1) There shall be a Director General of the Corporation who shall be its chief executive officer to be appointed by the Board. (2) The Director General shall be responsible for the management of the Corporation and for its procedures in financial and other matters under delegation from the Board.

9. Delegation of powers
The Board may, from time to time, delegate any of its powers to the Director-General or any other officer of the Corporation.

10. Functions of the Corporation
(1) The functions of the Corporation shall be to provide broadcasting services for general reception in all parts of Pakistan and to broadcast programmes that promote Islamic ideology, national unity, and principles of democracy.

11. Employment of officers and staff
The Board may, from time to time, employ such persons as it may consider necessary for the performance of its functions on such terms and conditions as it may prescribe by regulations.

12. Transfer of Radio Pakistan servants to the Corporation
(1) The Federal Government may transfer persons in the service of Pakistan and serving in connection with the affairs of Radio Pakistan to the Corporation on the same terms and conditions to which they were entitled immediately before such commencement.

1. Short title and commencement
This Act may be called the Pakistan Citizenship Act, 1951. It shall come into force at once.

2. Definitions
In this Act 'alien' means a person who is not a citizen of Pakistan or a Commonwealth citizen; 'Indo-Pakistan sub-continent' means India as defined in the Government of India Act, 1935; 'minor' means any person who has not completed the age of twenty-one years; 'prescribed' means prescribed by rules made under this Act.

3. Citizenship at the date of commencement of this Act
At the commencement of this Act, every person shall be deemed to be a citizen of Pakistan who or any of whose parents or grandparents was born in the territory now included in Pakistan and who after the fourteenth day of August, 1947, has not been permanently resident in any country outside Pakistan.

4. Citizenship by birth
Every person born in Pakistan after the commencement of this Act shall be a citizen of Pakistan by birth.

5. Citizenship by descent
A person born after the commencement of this Act shall be a citizen of Pakistan by descent if his parent is a citizen of Pakistan at the time of his birth.

6. Citizenship by migration
The Federal Government may, upon his obtaining a certificate of domicile under this Act, register as a citizen of Pakistan by migration any person who has migrated to the territories now included in Pakistan from any territory in the Indo-Pakistan sub-continent.

7. Persons migrating from the territories of Pakistan
A person who has after the first day of March, 1947, migrated from the territories now included in Pakistan to the territories now included in India shall not be a citizen of Pakistan.

8. Rights of citizenship of certain persons resident abroad
The Federal Government may, upon application made to it, register as a citizen of Pakistan any person who, or whose father or whose father’s father, was born in the Indo-Pakistan sub-continent and who is ordinarily resident in a country outside Pakistan.

9. Citizenship by naturalisation
The Federal Government may, upon an application made to it, register that person as a citizen of Pakistan by naturalization.

10. Married women
Any woman who by reason of her marriage to a British subject before the first day of January, 1949, has acquired the status of a British subject shall, if her husband becomes a citizen of Pakistan, be a citizen of Pakistan.

11. Registration of minors
The Federal Government may, upon application made in the prescribed manner by a parent or guardian of a minor child of a citizen of Pakistan, register the child as a citizen of Pakistan.

12. Citizenship by registration to begin on date of registration
Any person registered as a citizen of Pakistan shall be such a citizen from the date of his registration.

13. Citizenship by incorporation of territory
If any territory becomes a part of Pakistan the President may, by order, specify the persons who shall be citizens of Pakistan by reason of their connection with that territory.

14. Dual citizenship or nationality not permitted
Dual citizenship or nationality is not permitted.

14A. Renunciation of citizenship
Provisions regarding renunciation of citizenship.

14B. Certain persons to be citizens of Pakistan
Provisions regarding certain persons being citizens of Pakistan.

15. Persons becoming citizens to have the status of Commonwealth citizens
Persons becoming citizens shall have the status of Commonwealth citizens.

16. Deprivation of citizenship
Provisions regarding deprivation of citizenship.

16A. Certain persons to lose and others to retain citizenship
Provisions regarding loss and retention of citizenship.

17. Certificate of domicile
Provisions regarding certificate of domicile.

18. Delegation of powers
Provisions regarding delegation of powers.

19. Cases of doubt as to citizenship
Provisions regarding cases of doubt as to citizenship.

20. Acquisition of Pakistan citizenship by citizens of Commonwealth countries
Provisions regarding acquisition of citizenship by Commonwealth citizens.

21. Penalties
Provisions regarding penalties.

22. Interpretation
Provisions regarding interpretation.

23. Rules
Provisions regarding rules.

law: THE PAKISTAN CIVIL AVIATION AUTHORITY ORDINANCE
text:
1. Short title, extent and commencement
(1) This Ordinance may be called the Pakistan Civil Aviation Authority Ordinance, 1982. (2) It extends to the whole of Pakistan. (3) It shall come into force at once.

law: THE PAKISTAN CIVIL AVIATION AUTHORITY ORDINANCE
text:
2. Definitions
In this Ordinance, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context, (i) 'aerodrome' means any area of land or water designed, equipped, set apart or commonly used or intended to be used, either wholly or in part, for affording facilities for the landing and departure of aircraft, and includes all buildings, sheds, vessels and other structures and roads thereon or appert

law: THE PAKISTAN CIVIL AVIATION AUTHORITY ORDINANCE
text:
3. Establishment of the Authority
(1) As soon as may be after the commencement of this Ordinance, the Federal Government shall, by notification in the official Gazette, establish an authority to be known as the Civil Aviation Authority for carrying out the purposes of this Ordinance. (2) The Authority shall be a body corporate, having perpetual succession and a common seal with power, subject to t

law: THE PAKISTAN CIVIL AVIATION AUTHORITY ORDINANCE
text:
4. Power of the Federal Government to issue directives
The Federal Government may, as and when it considers necessary, issue directives to the Authority on matters of policy, and such directives shall be binding on the Authority, and if a question arises whether any matter is a matter of policy or not; the decision of the Federal Government shall be final.

law: THE PAKISTAN CIVIL AVIATION AUTHORITY ORDINANCE
text:
5. Powers and functions of the Authority
(1) The Authority shall be responsible for the regulation and control of civil aviation activities in the country. (2) The Authority shall from time to time prepare for the approval of the Federal Government five-year plans for the development of infrastructure for the promotion of safe, efficient, adequate, economical and properly coordinated civil air tra

law: THE PAKISTAN CIVIL AVIATION AUTHORITY ORDINANCE
text:
6. Control of air transport and aviation services
(1) Subject to the provisions of any other law for the time being in force, the Authority shall have control over (i) all the civil airports and aerodromes in the country including their planning, construction, operation and maintenance; (ii) air routes in Pakistan, in consultation with the Federal Government; (iii) airspace management of civil air

law: THE PAKISTAN CIVIL AVIATION AUTHORITY ORDINANCE
text:
7. Management
(1) The general direction and administration of the Authority and its affairs shall vest in a Board which may exercise all powers, perform all functions and do all acts and things which may be exercised, performed or done by the Authority.

law: THE PAKISTAN CIVIL AVIATION AUTHORITY ORDINANCE
text:
8. Executive Committee
(1) There shall be an Executive Committee of the Authority consisting of the Director-General, who shall be its head, and four other members, of whom three shall be nominated by the Board from amongst the most senior Officers of the Authority, and one to be nominated by the Ministry of Finance and designated as Finance Member.

law: THE PAKISTAN CIVIL AVIATION AUTHORITY ORDINANCE
text:
9. Director-General his duties, functions and powers
The Director-General shall perform such duties and exercise such powers as may be assigned to him by the Authority.

law: THE PAKISTAN CIVIL AVIATION AUTHORITY ORDINANCE
text:
10. Delegation of powers
The Authority may delegate any of its powers to the Director-General or any other officer of the Authority.

law: THE PAKISTAN CIVIL AVIATION AUTHORITY ORDINANCE
text:
11. Transfer of assets and liabilities of the Department of Civil Aviation to the Authority
All assets and liabilities of the Department of Civil Aviation shall stand transferred to the Authority.

law: THE PAKISTAN CIVIL AVIATION AUTHORITY ORDINANCE
text:
12. Recruitment of officers, etc
The Authority shall have the power to recruit officers and staff as may be necessary for the performance of its functions.

law: THE PAKISTAN CIVIL AVIATION AUTHORITY ORDINANCE
text:
13. Members, officers etc, to be public servants
All members, officers and employees of the Authority shall be deemed to be public servants within the meaning of the Pakistan Penal Code.

law: THE PAKISTAN CIVIL AVIATION AUTHORITY ORDINANCE
text:
14. Transfer of civil servants, etc, to the Authority
The Federal Government may transfer any civil servant to the Authority.

law: THE PAKISTAN CIVIL AVIATION AUTHORITY ORDINANCE
text:
15. Budget
The Authority shall prepare its budget for each financial year and submit it to the Federal Government for approval.

law: THE PAKISTAN CIVIL AVIATION AUTHORITY ORDINANCE
text:
16. Civil Aviation Authority Fund
There shall be established a fund to be known as the Civil Aviation Authority Fund.

law: THE PAKISTAN CIVIL AVIATION AUTHORITY ORDINANCE
text:
17. Maintenance of accounts
The Authority shall maintain proper accounts and other relevant records.

law: THE PAKISTAN CIVIL AVIATION AUTHORITY ORDINANCE
text:
18. Audit
The accounts of the Authority shall be audited annually by a qualified auditor.

law: THE PAKISTAN CIVIL AVIATION AUTHORITY ORDINANCE
text:
19. Authority to be deemed to be a local authority
The Authority shall be deemed to be a local authority for the purposes of any law for the time being in force.

law: THE PAKISTAN CIVIL AVIATION AUTHORITY ORDINANCE
text:
20. Liability of the Federal Government to be limited
The liability of the Federal Government in respect of the Authority shall be limited.

law: THE PAKISTAN CIVIL AVIATION AUTHORITY ORDINANCE
text:
21. Submission of yearly reports, returns, etc
The Authority shall submit yearly reports and returns to the Federal Government.

law: THE PAKISTAN CIVIL AVIATION AUTHORITY ORDINANCE
text:
22. Exemption from taxes
The Authority shall be exempt from all taxes and duties.

law: THE PAKISTAN CIVIL AVIATION AUTHORITY ORDINANCE
text:
23. Ordinance XXIII of 1969 not to apply to Authority
The provisions of Ordinance XXIII of 1969 shall not apply to the Authority.

law: THE PAKISTAN CIVIL AVIATION AUTHORITY ORDINANCE
text:
24. Indemnity
No suit or legal proceedings shall lie against the Authority or any member or officer thereof for anything done in good faith.

law: THE PAKISTAN CIVIL AVIATION AUTHORITY ORDINANCE
text:
25. Certain existing arrangements to continue
Any existing arrangements for the management of civil aviation shall continue until modified or revoked.

law: THE PAKISTAN CIVIL AVIATION AUTHORITY ORDINANCE
text:
26. Power of Federal Government to make rules
The Federal Government may make rules for carrying out the purposes of this Ordinance.

law: THE PAKISTAN CIVIL AVIATION AUTHORITY ORDINANCE
text:
27. Power of the Authority to make regulations
The Authority may make regulations for the conduct of its affairs.

law: THE PAKISTAN CIVIL AVIATION AUTHORITY ORDINANCE
text:
28. Winding up of the Authority
The Authority may be wound up in accordance with the provisions of this Ordinance.

law: THE PAKISTAN CIVIL AVIATION AUTHORITY ORDINANCE
text:
29. Removal of difficulties
If any difficulty arises in giving effect to the provisions of this Ordinance, the Federal Government may make such provisions as appear to it to be necessary for removing the difficulty.

1. Short title, application and commencement
(1) This Act may be called the Pakistan Coast Guards Act, 1973. (2) It shall apply to all members of the Pakistan Coast Guards wherever they may be serving. (3) It shall come into force at once.

2. Interpretation
In this Act, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context, various definitions are provided for terms such as 'Coastal area', 'Commandant', 'Custody', 'Deputy Director General', 'Director General', 'Force', 'Junior Commissioned Officer', 'Member of the Force', 'Officer', 'Prescribed', and 'Superior Officer'.

3. Powers to constitute and maintain the force and its functions
The Federal Government may constitute and maintain a Force to be called the Pakistan Coast Guards for performing functions such as prevention of smuggling, illegal immigration, stopping enemy agents, and supplementing defense in war.

4. Appointment of officers of Force
The Federal Government may appoint any member of any of the Defence Services of Pakistan to be Director General, Deputy Director General, Commandant, and other Commissioned Officers.

5. Appointment of subordinate and ministerial staff
(1) The Director General or a person authorized may appoint junior commissioned officers, subordinate and ministerial staff. (2) Appointments shall be made by direct recruitment or promotion. (3) The recruiting roll and affirmation shall be read out in the presence of a Commandant. (4) The affirmation shall be repeated by the person making it.

6. Superintendence, command, control and administration of the Force
The Force shall be commanded and administered by the Director General under the superintendence and control of the Federal Government.

7. Pay, pension, etc., of officers and members
The officers and members of the Force shall receive pay, pension, and other remuneration as prescribed.

8. Members to be subject to Pakistan Army Act, 1952
(1) Every officer and member of the Force shall be subject to the Pakistan Army Act, 1952. (2) The Director General shall have powers conferred by the Act on an officer empowered to convene a general court martial.

9. Consequence of sentence of imprisonment
A member of the Force sentenced to imprisonment for not less than ninety days shall be deemed to have been dismissed from the Force.

10. Suspension
Any officer or junior commissioned officer may suspend a member of the Force for misconduct.

11. Place of imprisonment
A member sentenced to imprisonment may be confined in a quarterguard or other suitable place as determined by the Director General.

12. Capture of deserters
(1) The Commandant shall inform civil authorities of any desertion. (2) Police officers may arrest without warrant any deserter.

13. Appeal and revision
(1) A person aggrieved may appeal within thirty days of an order. (2) A person aggrieved by the Director General's order may apply for revision within thirty days.

14. Powers of the officers of the Force
(1) Officers and members shall perform customs functions and exercise powers under the Customs Act, 1969. (2) They shall also exercise powers conferred on police officers under the Police Act, 1861.

15. Disposal of goods seized by members of the Force
All goods seized shall be dealt with according to the Customs Act, 1969.

16. Placing of Force under command of Chief of Staff, Pakistan Army
(1) The Federal Government may place the Force under the command of the Chief of Staff of the Pakistan Army. (2) The Force remains subject to this Act.

17. Indemnity
No legal proceeding shall lie against any person for actions done in good faith under this Act.

18. Power to make rules and regulations
(1) The Federal Government may make rules regulating functions and powers. (2) The Director General may make regulations consistent with this Act.

law: The Pakistan College of Physicians and Surgeons Ordinance
text:

(1) This Ordinance may be called the Pakistan College of Physicians and Surgeons Ordinance, 1962. (2) It extends to the whole of Pakistan. (3) It shall come into force at once.

law: The Pakistan College of Physicians and Surgeons Ordinance
text:

In this Ordinance, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context, (a) “College” means the Pakistan College of Physicians and Surgeons established under section 3; (b) “Council” means the Council of the College constituted under section 6; (c) “Fellow” means a Fellow of the College; (d) “prescribed” means prescribed by rules made under section 19.

law: The Pakistan College of Physicians and Surgeons Ordinance
text:

(2) The College shall be a body corporate, having perpetual succession and a common seal, with power to acquire, hold and dispose of property, both movable and immovable, and shall, by the said name, sue

law: The Pakistan College of Physicians and Surgeons Ordinance
text:

The College shall consist of the following persons who shall be called the Fellows of the College, namely: (a) persons, who have post-graduate medical qualifications with experience in teaching, research or public health administration, or who have attained eminence in any branch of medical science or public health administration, to be appointed as Fellows by the Federal

law: The Pakistan College of Physicians and Surgeons Ordinance
text:
5. Functions of the College
The following shall be the functions of the College, namely: (1) to promote specialist practice of medicine, surgery, gynaecology and obstetrics and such other specialities by securing improvement of teaching and training in hospitals and hospital methods; (2) to arrange post-graduate medical, surgical and other specialists training; (3) to hold and conduct examinations

law: The Pakistan College of Physicians and Surgeons Ordinance
text:
